Some Thoughts And Information About Auto-Sharing Plussed Posts

There's been a lot of talk in the past day or so about the new Google+ mechanism of placing posts in your Stream that were plussed by people you have circled. I thought I'd summarize parts of it and offer some thoughts and suggestions.

First of all, what are we talking about? The feature implemented is a system by which if someone you have circled plusses a post, Google+ will sometimes put that post in your Stream, even if you don't have the author circled. I believe that Google's intent here is to try and bring content to our attention that would interest us and that we otherwise might have missed. I think it's an admirable goal that will be improved upon along the way, but that the step as initially implemented has a couple of significant flaws. The most obvious flaw is that there is currently no way to turn off receiving these posts in the main Stream. I feel that the biggest part of the controversy would be alleviated by simply giving people the option of turning it off, or better yet making it an opt-in system that people could choose to turn on.

Since that option does not exist, and since it is possible to turn off the feature from the sending end, I have chosen to do that. In case you are interested in turning it off so that you don't feel like you're spamming people, you can simply click on https://plus.google.com/u/0/apps/google and choose who will see your plus-one activity. (I attached a picture of the dialog below.) Setting it to "Only you" will get it to stop sending out the posts you plus to anyone in your circles. Setting to "Public" means the posts can go to anyone who has you circled, "Your circles" means anyone who has you circled who you also have circled, and "Extended circles" means anyone who has you circled who is either part of your circles or who is circled by anyone in your circles. Whew, it's a little confusing, but hopefully not too bad.

I think the core problem is that there are multiple reasons people plus a post. If the plus always meant "Wow! That's a great post and I love it!" then the new system might be a decent first stab at helping you to find content you'd like based on what the people you have circled like. However, that's not always, or even most of the time, the meaning. I often use a plus-one along the lines of "I have read your post and am acknowledging that fact to you, the author, but I don't find the post so inspiring that I feel the need to comment on it." In the case of that meaning, the new system is going to find potentially so-so posts to share with people who have me circled, where it would get much better results if it shared out the posts I'm commenting on instead.

I like the direction that Google appears to want to go with this. I want them to be able to find content that will interest me and present it to me, even if I didn't know enough to find it myself. Unfortunately I think this step along that path brings too much noise along with the signal based on the current implementation. I have faith that the developers will continue to improve things, and that down the road my Stream will always be full of exactly the things I would find most interesting to read. In the meantime, if we all provide feedback on what we do and don't like about the system it will help them get there.

Please let me know if I've missed any details, or if you have a completely different take on the issue.

How To Turn Off +1 Activity Sharing To Your G+ Followers
Go to Account Settings>>Google+>>Manage Apps and Activities>>Google>>Switch your +1 Activity to "Only You" 
https://plus.google.com/u/0/apps/google

Mobile Apps - Settings>>Your Name>>Sharing>>+1s from posts>> Switch to "Only You" privacy.

Mobile Web - Switch your browser to DESKTOP User Agent (Request Desktop Site or Website Preference to Desktop Mode) and then go to 
https://plus.google.com/u/0/apps/google and switch the +1 activity sharing to "Only You" privacy.
